channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: Hawthorn have replicated the dimensions at GMHBA Stadium in preparation for their Friday night clash with Geelong on the Cats' home deck.
item.title: Hawks heading down the highway with confidence

item.dc:creator: Simone Fox Koob
item.description: Will Callaghan, 14, has been found safe after being missing for two days on Mount Disappointment summit, about 50km north of Melbourne.
item.title: 'He was angelic, just standing there': Teen found after days missing on Mount Disappointment

item.dc:creator: Jocelyn Garcia
item.description: Three officers are seeking further medical advice on their injuries.
item.title: Three officers injured at Queensland correctional centre

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: Josh Caddy has been left out of the Richmond side to face Collingwood, but the Tigers have indicated his calf ailment is minor.
item.title: Caddy to miss Pies clash with 'minor' calf complaint

item.dc:creator: Nathan Hondros
item.description: The WA Labor government is being accused of "shocking double standards" after Health Minister Roger Cook said his wife Carly Lane was planning to represent him at an anti-racism rally on Saturday.
item.title: 'Shocking double standards': WA health minister's wife to attend anti-racism rally despite lockdown

item.description: Check out how our experts tipped round two and get all the ins and outs for round two as they drop.
item.title: AFL round two: Teams and expert tips

item.description: The finest photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: The best of the world in pictures

item.description: Ashley Cooper, hailed by Roy Emerson as having no weaknesses on the court, became a tennis poster boy.
item.title: Tennis all-rounder netted four Grand Slams

item.description: The Japanese government has repeatedly expressed deep concern about China's plan to enact sweeping national security legislation in the former British colony.
item.title: Shinzo Abe to lead G7 response to China's Hong Kong push

item.dc:creator: Tom Rabe
item.description: The coronavirus pandemic should be the catalyst for government to review all business cases for multibillion-dollar infrastructure projects, according to a transport expert.
item.title: Calls for NSW to review transport projects amid COVID-19 crisis

item.dc:creator: The Herald's View
item.description: Those working to prevent domestic violence have been hit with a double whammy: a surge in cases and diminished access to safe spaces.
item.title: How to stop the shadow pandemic of domestic violence

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: The Hong Kong casino giant will have to hand over secret company documents to a NSW government inquiry into probity issues at James Packer's Crown Resorts.Â
item.title: Melco fails final bid to avoid giving documents to Crown probe

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: The Aurora Australis, Australia's principal research vessel for almost three decades, is headed for the ship-breaking beaches of south Asia unless funds for its purchase and maintenance can be found within weeks.
item.title: Aurora Australis faces voyage to wrecker without a last-minute rescue

item.description: Epstein, the late multimillionaire financier accused of sexually abusing countless underage girls, got remarkable treatment from both state and federal prosecutors.
item.title: Jeffrey Epstein grand jury records to stay sealed

item.dc:creator: Jennifer Duke
item.description: A $7 billion proposal from a superannuation consortium to build Melbourne's airport rail link remains on the outer despite a calling for super funds to spend.
item.title: Super bid for Melbourne airport rail set to fail despite Treasurer's push

item.dc:creator: Greg Baum
item.description: It's impossible to deny that the pause in the footy season left a hole. Now it's back, and not a moment too soon.
item.title: Footy's back to straighten up our axis

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: The Dragons' connection with the Sailor family extends back more than a decade, but that could be about to come to an end.
item.title: More Dragons drama as Tristan Sailor looks for exit

item.dc:creator: Natassia Chrysanthos
item.description: "It's disappointing news to hear as a student, and deeply concerning given the current global anti-racist movement," said history student Annabel Pettit.
item.title: Subjects on US slavery and fascism slated for cuts at Sydney University

item.dc:creator: Simone Fox Koob
item.description: It was at lunchtime on Wednesday that whispers began to filter among searchers in bushland on Melbourne's fringe that the boy they were all soÂ desperately searching for may have been spotted.
item.title: 'This is one of the great ones': Search for teen ends in celebration

item.description: As has become something of a TV custom, the term "celebrity" here is loosely applied.
item.title: What's on TV: Thursday June 18

item.description: The Front Bar has made its mark with segments like Under the Pump and From the Archives.
item.title: What's on TV: Wednesday June 17

item.dc:creator: Michael Gleeson
item.description: No.1 draft pick Matt Rowell has agreed terms to stay at the Gold Coast Suns for an extra two years.
item.title: Young gun set to stay a Sun

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: Former financial adviser Sam Henderson has been charged with multiple counts of dishonest conduct over allegations he falsely claimed to have a master's degree.
item.title: Former celebrity financial adviser charged with dishonest conduct

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: The concerns come as family and friends of Rob Pedretti, the 60-year-old Queensland surfer who died from a shark bite at Kingscliff, prepare for his funeral.
item.title: Calls for more mitigation after 'big sharks seen' in the NSW region

item.dc:creator: Erin Pearson
item.description: The arresting officer has told an inquest he is still haunted by the death, but he believes he was looking out for the Pierino Taranto's welfare.
item.title: Homeless man suffered fatal neck fracture during arrest for drunkenness, coroner hears

item.dc:creator: Rob Harris
item.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison has asked an expert panel to review a decision to deny war hero Edward 'Teddy' Sheean a posthumous Victoria Cross.
item.title: Expert panel to review WWII sailor's Victoria Cross case

item.description: It's a shame that smart, spirited and sexy 2014 local drama Party Tricks only lasted one season.
item.title: What's on TV: Tuesday June 16

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: The OECD has warned Australia's recovery from the coronavirus pandemic would be derailed if a second wave of infections hit the nation.
item.title: Second virus wave would derail Australian economy: OECD

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: The move is a sign of both clubs' determination to reward loyal members, many of whom were resigned to not seeing any games this season.
item.title: Swans, Giants will wear cost to get fans back to games

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: The game will be shorter, smaller and operating under a strict set of protocols, but when Richmond play Collingwood on Thursday night, all will be forgotten.
item.title: How football has changed since the coronavirus shutdown

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Scott Morrison says travel restrictions are costing jobs and putting the tourism industry at risk, while NZ is also itching for a travel bubble.
item.title: Morrison urges state and territory leaders to open borders in July

item.description: Follow news and events as they happen.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Chris Vedelago
item.description: Man linked to one of worst industrial fires in Melbourneâs recent history faces criminal charges for creating illegal chemical stockpile that sparked the blaze.
item.title: Charges laid over chemical stockpile that led to West Footscray blaze

item.dc:creator: Chris Roots
item.description: The betting inquiry was adjourned because an expert witness in his defence was unavailable to give evidence on Thursday.
item.title: Hyeronimus betting inquiry adjourned

item.dc:creator: Rachael Dexter
item.description: The global death toll from coronavirus has passed 408,000 and there are more than 7.1 million known cases of infection, according to Johns Hopkins University.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Prime Minister urges states and territories to open borders in July, 7 new cases in Australia

item.description: One of the more promising fillies in provincial NSW can hit back at Thursday's feature Gosford meeting after a luckless and narrow defeat here last start.
item.title: Salina dreaming of victory to make up for unlucky effort

item.description: Everything you need to know to pick a winner on an eight-race card.
item.title: Race-by-race tips and preview for Gosford on Thursday

item.dc:creator: Vince Rugari
item.description: Almost two weeks since plans to resume the A-League were put in place, players still have no idea when they will return to training with their clubs.
item.title: 'No transparency': Oar says players fuming at A-League restart silence

item.dc:creator: Chris Vedelago
item.description: Nik Dimopoulos, who was seriously hurt when police mistakenly raided a gay community book shop last year, is suing the state government for compensation.
item.title: Innocent, bashed man sues police over botched Hares & Hyenas raid

item.dc:creator: Michael Fowler
item.description: Health Minister Jenny Mikakos notes discussions about allowing a limited number of fans into AFL matches but insists Victoria isn't ready to follow other states.
item.title: Disability service quarantined, Mikakos confirms AFL crowd discussions

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: Seven and Fox Footy are determined to keep it real but add atmosphere to the weekend's broadcast when footy resumes without crowds
item.title: What can we expect from the TV broadcast when footy returns?

item.dc:creator: Madeleine Heffernan
item.description: The average attendance rate for Indigenous students was 81.5 per cent last year, compared with 92 per cent for non-Indigenous students.
item.title: Indigenous students' school attendance gap grows

item.dc:creator: Eryk Bagshaw
item.description: The former British colony is battling with questions over its judicial, corporate and now media freedom as Beijing imposes new laws that will punish dissent.
item.title: Hong Kong media must 'embrace' new laws: public broadcaster told

item.dc:creator: Georgina Robinson
item.description: A group of Rebels executives took a blank canvas approach to rugby in 2021. Their proposal is now in play with one of the world's biggest private equity groups.
item.title: Private equity giant in talks with Rugby Australia

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: The officer pleaded not guilty and will stand trial in September, with CCTV and sworn statements expected to form part of the prosecutionâs evidence.
item.title: Police custody officer accused of assaulting detainee at Perth Watch House

item.dc:creator: Nick Miller
item.description: The Melbourne Theatre Company, unable to stage shows for live performance, is recording a series of audio productions.
item.title: Back in the rehearsal studio, disinfected hands open scripts at last

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: Australia's UFC champion Alexander Volkanovski will be front and centre next month when the organisation's "fight island" in Abu Dhabi hosts its first event.
item.title: Volkanovski heads to 'fight island' for first world title defence

item.description: As thousands of Australians backed Black Lives Matter on the streets, donations were pouring in for Indigenous organisations, charities and legal services.
item.title: 'Stronger together': Indigenous groups see donation boom amid protests

item.dc:creator: Adam Cooper
item.description: Lawyers for a senior police officer accused of unlawfully leaking crime reports to the media during his tilt at state politics have argued his charges are invalid.
item.title: Disclosure charges against senior policeman 'invalid'
